verses.verse: A psalm of Asaph.[c] God is truly good to the upright,[d] to those who are pure in heart.
[e]But as for me, I nearly lost my balance;[f] I was almost at the point of stumbling.
For I was filled with envy of the arrogant when I perceived how the wicked prosper.
[g]They endure no painful suffering; their bodies are healthy and well fed.
They are not plagued with burdens common to all; the troubles of life do not afflict them.
So they wear arrogance like a necklace and don violence like a robe.
Their callous hearts overflow with malice, and their minds are completely taken up with evil plans.
They mock and pour forth their malevolence; in their haughtiness they threaten oppression.
Their mouths rage against the heavens while their tongues are never stilled on the earth.
[h]So the people blindly follow them and find nothing offensive in their words.[i]
They say: “How does God know? Does the Most High notice anything?”
Such are the wicked, as they pile up wealth, without any concerns.
[j]Is it in vain that I have kept my heart clean and washed my hands in innocence?
For I am stricken day after day and punished every morning.
If I had decided, “I will speak like them,” I would not have been true to your children.[k]
[l]When I tried to understand all this, I found it too difficult for me,
until I entered the sanctuary of God[m] and realized what their final end would be.
[n]Indeed, you set them on a slippery slope and cast them headlong into utter ruin.
How suddenly they are destroyed, completely wiped out by terrors!
When you arise, O LORD, you will dismiss them as one discards a dream on awakening.
[o]When my heart was embittered and my soul was deeply tormented,
I was stupid and unable to comprehend— like a brute beast in your presence.
[p]Yet I am always with you; you grasp me by the right hand.
You guide me with your counsel, and afterward you will receive me into glory.[q]
Whom do I have in heaven except you? And besides you there is nothing else I desire on earth.
Even should my heart and my flesh[r] fail, God is the rock of my heart and my portion forever.
[s]But all those who are far from you will perish; you destroy those who are unfaithful to you.
As for me, my happiness is to be near God, and I have made the Lord GOD my refuge; I will proclaim all your works[t] at the gates of the Daughter of Zion.
